009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.points;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements 2D point fitting under affine (three-point)
023 * transformations (exact and least-squares). See Sec. 21.1.3 of [1] for
024 * details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/08/01
033 */
034public class AffineFit2d implements LinearFit2d {
035        
036        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
037        private final double err;               // the calculated error
038        
039        /**
040         * Constructor.
041         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using an affine transformation model.
042         * At least 3 point pairs are required. For 3 point pairs, the solution
043         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
044         * 
045         * @param P the source points
046         * @param Q the target points
047         */
048        public AffineFit2d(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {      // 
049                checkSize(P, Q);
050                int m = P.length;
051                
052                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2 * m, 6);
053                RealVector b = new ArrayRealVector(2 * m);
054                
055                // mount the matrix M
056                int row = 0;
057                for (Pnt2d p : P) {
058                        M.setEntry(row, 0, p.getX());
059                        M.setEntry(row, 1, p.getY());
060                        M.setEntry(row, 2, 1);
061                        row++;
062                        M.setEntry(row, 3, p.getX());
063                        M.setEntry(row, 4, p.getY());
064                        M.setEntry(row, 5, 1);
065                        row++;
066                }
067                
068                // mount vector b
069                row = 0;
070                for (Pnt2d q : Q) {
071                        b.setEntry(row, q.getX());
072                        row++;
073                        b.setEntry(row, q.getY());
074                        row++;
075                }
076                
077                // solve M * a = b (for the unknown parameter vector a):
078                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
079                RealVector a = solver.solve(b);
080                A = makeTransformationMatrix(a);
081                err = Math.sqrt(LinearFit2d.getSquaredError(P, Q, A.getData()));
082        }
083
084        // creates a (2 x 3) transformation matrix from the elements of a
085        private RealMatrix makeTransformationMatrix(RealVector a) {
086                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2, 3);
087                int i = 0;
088                for (int row = 0; row < 2; row++) {
089                        // get (n+1) elements from a and place in row
090                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
091                                A.setEntry(row, j, a.getEntry(i));
092                                i++;
093                        }
094                }
095                return A;
096        }
097        
098        // --------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        private void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
101                if (P.length < 3 || Q.length < 3) {
102                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 3 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
103                }
104        }
105        
106        // --------------------------------------------------------
107
108        @Override
109        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
110                return A.getData();
111//              return A;
112        }
113
114        @Override
115        public double getError() {
116                return err;
117        }
118
119}
